page.title: 16FOOTPATHS OF STOKE PRIOR.
page.content: A {footpath }is a dirt track which animals and people have walked for centuries to go the shortest way to church,town or public house. These paths go over all kinds of territory public and private, and on these walks you can see more of the countryside's flora and fauna than from roadways. {Worcestershire has more public {footpaths that any other county,}about four and half kilometres for each square km, but this 12km block has approximately 116km of footpaths and bridleways. However, the area around {Stoke Prior}has very few footpaths, and recently another was closed because it went through the site of a newly formed nature reserve and reservoir at Upton Warren.{The only {footpaths now }lead from the village to church and to the old Roman Road,today's A38.
